articles.title: ‘Sad, if not damning’: Cathie Wood blasts the proxy firms who say Elon Musk’s $1 trillion pay package is just too rich - Fortune
articles.description: “Index-based investing is a form of socialism. Our investment system is broken,” the longtime Tesla bull said, calling proxy firms “menaces to innovation.”
articles.content: Investor Cathie Wood, a long-time Tesla bull known for first investing in the company a decade ago at $13 per share, condemned the growing resistance to Tesla CEO Elon Musks potential $1 trillion pay… [+5667 chars]

articles.title: Apple approaches $4 trillion valuation as confidence reignites after iPhone 17 launch (AAPL:NASDAQ) - Seeking Alpha

articles.author: Jim Edwards
articles.title: Stock traders are delighted at the prospect of Trump losing his tariff war - Fortune
articles.description: Investors are increasingly convinced that the Fed’s rate cuts are now locked in. The notion that the U.S. Supreme Court may rule that Trump’s tariffs are illegal would be the icing on the equity cake.
articles.content: S&P 500 futures rose 0.27% this morning, premarket, with indexes in Asia and Europe also broadly rising as traders savored strong economic growth in China, a new pro-stimulus government in Japan,… [+2500 chars]

articles.author: Alan Ohnsman
articles.title: RJ Scaringe Is Betting His New Electric SUV Will Make Rivian The Next Tesla - Forbes
articles.description: The Rivian founder and CEO expects its small SUV R2, priced from $45,000, to be fully competitive with Tesla’s top-selling Model Y when sales begin early next year.
articles.content: Rivian has had a rocky time since it began selling electric vehicles in 2021. It missed initial volume goals, leading to back-to-back years of weak sales. Then there have been post-COVID parts shorta… [+7248 chars]
